comments:
(using 7/22 i-build) I was attempting to verify one of the bugs where generic
server instances end up with default properties after you've already created and
deleted one instance of that type and, after deleting my existing WLS 8.1 server
instance, an attempt to create a new one generated the following sequence of
stack traces (note: the new server dialog did open and I was able to
successfully create a new instance and then start it):

Rob/Gorkem,
  I'm also seing this NullPointer albeit under slightly different circumstances
that I havn't yet managed to reproduce.  However, I can add that the exception
is being swallowed (and traced) at
org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.getRootModules() if that helps
debugging the problem.


> (using 7/22 i-build) I was attempting to verify one of the bugs where generic
> server instances end up with default properties after you've already created and
> deleted one instance of that type and, after deleting my existing WLS 8.1 server
> instance, an attempt to create a new one generated the following sequence of
